--- engine: knitr title: Measuring performance --- ## Learning objectives: - Understand how to improve your code for making it faster - Learn what are the tools for improving your code - Test how to profile your code ## Introduction > "Before you can make your code faster, you first need to figure out whatâ€™s making it slow." ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![SLOW DOWN TO LEARN HOW TO CODE FASTER | credits: packtpub.com](images/23_code_faster.jpeg){fig-align='center' width=348} ::: ::: - **profile** your code: measure the run-time of each line of code using realistic inputs - **experiment** with alternatives to find faster code - **microbenchmark** to measure the difference in performance. ## Profiling ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(profvis) library(bench) ``` ::: The tool to use is a **profiler**, it allows for **sampling** the code performance through stopping the execution of code every few milliseconds and recording all the steps. Example: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} f <- function() { pause(0.1) g() h() } g <- function() { pause(0.1) h() } h <- function() { pause(0.1) } ``` ::: Profile the execution of f(): profvis::pause() is used instead of Sys.sleep() profile f(), with utils::Rprof() ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tmp <- tempfile() Rprof(tmp, interval = 0.1) f() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> NULL ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} Rprof(NULL) writeLines(readLines(tmp)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> sample.interval=100000 #> "pause" "f" "eval" "eval" "withVisible" "withCallingHandlers" "eval" "eval" "with_handlers" "doWithOneRestart" "withOneRestart" "withRestartList" "doWithOneRestart" "withOneRestart" "withRestartList" "withRestarts" "evaluate::evaluate" "evaluate" "in_dir" "in_input_dir" "eng_r" "block_exec" "call_block" "process_group" "withCallingHandlers" "xfun:::handle_error" "process_file" "knitr::knit" "rmarkdown::render" "execute" ".main" #> "pause" "g" "f" "eval" "eval" "withVisible" "withCallingHandlers" "eval" "eval" "with_handlers" "doWithOneRestart" "withOneRestart" "withRestartList" "doWithOneRestart" "withOneRestart" "withRestartList" "withRestarts" "evaluate::evaluate" "evaluate" "in_dir" "in_input_dir" "eng_r" "block_exec" "call_block" "process_group" "withCallingHandlers" "xfun:::handle_error" "process_file" "knitr::knit" "rmarkdown::render" "execute" ".main" #> "pause" "h" "g" "f" "eval" "eval" "withVisible" "withCallingHandlers" "eval" "eval" "with_handlers" "doWithOneRestart" "withOneRestart" "withRestartList" "doWithOneRestart" "withOneRestart" "withRestartList" "withRestarts" "evaluate::evaluate" "evaluate" "in_dir" "in_input_dir" "eng_r" "block_exec" "call_block" "process_group" "withCallingHandlers" "xfun:::handle_error" "process_file" "knitr::knit" "rmarkdown::render" "execute" ".main" #> "pause" "h" "f" "eval" "eval" "withVisible" "withCallingHandlers" "eval" "eval" "with_handlers" "doWithOneRestart" "withOneRestart" "withRestartList" "doWithOneRestart" "withOneRestart" "withRestartList" "withRestarts" "evaluate::evaluate" "evaluate" "in_dir" "in_input_dir" "eng_r" "block_exec" "call_block" "process_group" "withCallingHandlers" "xfun:::handle_error" "process_file" "knitr::knit" "rmarkdown::render" "execute" ".main" ``` ::: ::: **Visualising profiles** Makes easier to build up a mental model of what you need to change: profvis::profvis() utils::summaryRprof() ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} source("scripts/profiling-example.R") profvis(f()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: **Memory profiling and the garbage collector** Profiling a loop that modifies an existing variable: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} profvis::profvis({ x <- integer() for (i in 1:1e4) { x <- c(x, i) } }) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: You can figure out what is the source of the problem by looking at the memory column. In this case, **copy-on-modify** acts in each iteration of the loop creating another copy of x. **Limitations** - Profiling does not extend to C code - Anonymous functions are hard to figure out - Arguments are evaluated inside another function ### Exercise ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} profvis::profvis({ f <- function(n = 1e5) { x <- rep(1, n) rm(x) } },torture = TRUE) ``` ::: ?rm() [solution](https://advanced-r-solutions.rbind.io/measuring-performance.html) ## Microbenchmarking *Measurement of the performance of a very small piece of code* is useful for comparing small snippets of code for specific tasks. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Credits: Google search-engine](images/23_microbenchmarking.jpeg){fig-align='center' width=159} ::: ::: The {bench} package uses a high precision time. bench::mark() ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(bench) x <- runif(100) (lb <- bench::mark( sqrt(x), x ^ 0.5 )) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> # A tibble: 2 Ã— 6 #> expression min median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec` #> #> 1 sqrt(x) 200ns 400ns 2112914. 848B 0 #> 2 x^0.5 2.3Âµs 2.7Âµs 350293. 848B 0 ``` ::: ::: - heavily right-skewed distribution ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} require(ggbeeswarm) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Loading required package: ggbeeswarm ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Loading required package: ggplot2 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} plot(lb) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](23_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Resources - [profvis package](https://rstudio.github.io/profvis/) - [bench package](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/bench/bench.pdf) - [solutions](https://advanced-r-solutions.rbind.io/measuring-performance.html) ## Meeting Videos ### Cohort 1 (no video) ### Cohort 2 ### Cohort 3 ### Cohort 4 ### Cohort 5 ### Cohort 6 ### Cohort 7
